storyTitle: Identify Unused Imports in Test File
actions: Identified unused 'within' import from @testing-library/react on line 15
Confirmed root cause of TypeScript error TS6133
Verified all other imports (screen, waitFor, userEvent, render, App, vitest utilities) are actively used
notes: Analysis confirmed 'within' import from @testing-library/react is unused on line 15. All 10 other imported symbols are actively used throughout the 595-line test file. The fix for Story #2 is to remove 'within' from the import statement. Code quality is otherwise excellent with comprehensive test coverage across all theme switching scenarios.

storyTitle: Remove Unused Import from Test File
actions: Verified test file syntax remains valid
Confirmed no TypeScript errors (0 errors in project)
Verified 'within' is not used anywhere in the file
notes: Successfully removed unused import. File syntax valid, all tests passing. The import statement on line 15 now correctly imports only 'screen' and 'waitFor' from @testing-library/react. TypeScript compilation confirms no errors.

storyTitle: Validate CI/CD Pipeline Type Check Passes
actions: Ran TypeScript type check with 'npx tsc -b --noEmit'
Confirmed pipeline validation - type check exits with code 0
notes: TypeScript type check passes successfully with 0 errors. TS6133 error resolved. The unused 'within' import has been successfully removed from line 15, and the project-wide type check confirms no type errors remain. The fix from Story #2 has successfully resolved the pipeline quality gate issue.
